implementation.functions: -- -------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Reactor -- Copyright 2018 Patrick H. Rigney, All Rights Reserved. -- https://www.toggledbits.com/reactor -- -------------------------------------------------------------------- function startupReactor(devNum) luup.log("Reactor STARTUP!") Reactor = require("L_Reactor") reactorTick = Reactor.tick reactorWatch = Reactor.watch reactorRequestHandler = Reactor.request luup.register_handler("reactorRequestHandler", "Reactor") return Reactor.startPlugin(devNum) end

action.name: ResetRuntime
action.run: luup.variable_set( "urn:toggledbits-com:serviceId:ReactorSensor", "TripCount", "0", lul_device ) luup.variable_set( "urn:toggledbits-com:serviceId:ReactorSensor", "Runtime", "0", lul_device ) luup.variable_set( "urn:toggledbits-com:serviceId:ReactorSensor", "RuntimeSince", os.time(), lul_device ) return true

action.name: SetTarget
action.run: if tostring(lul_settings.newTargetValue) ~= "0" then Reactor.actionTrip( lul_device ) else Reactor.actionReset( lul_device ) end return true

action.name: ToggleState
action.run: local t = luup.variable_get( "urn:micasaverde-com:serviceId:SecuritySensor1", "Tripped", lul_device ) or "0" if t == "0" then Reactor.actionTrip( lul_device ) else Reactor.actionReset( lul_device ) end return true

action.name: RunScene
action.job: -- Run scene in Reactor master device context. -- See https://www.toggledbits.com/reactor for explanation of Options local opt = lul_settings.Options or {} opt.contextDevice = opt.contextDevice or lul_device Reactor.actionRunScene( lul_settings.SceneNum, opt, lul_device ) return 4,0

action.name: RunScene
action.job: -- Run scene in ReactorSensor context. -- See https://www.toggledbits.com/reactor for explanation of Options -- The ReactorSensor version of RunScene forces the context device to be the -- ReactorSensor on which the call was made. local opt = lul_settings.Options or {} opt.contextDevice = opt.contextDevice or lul_device Reactor.actionRunScene( lul_settings.SceneNum, opt, lul_device ) return 4,0

action.name: RunScene
action.job: -- Run scene in "global" context. -- See https://www.toggledbits.com/reactor for explanation of Options -- This is a convenience/shortcut version of RunScene that allows -- users to use ReactorScenes with only a change to the device number in -- their action calls. local opt = lul_settings.Options or {} opt.contextDevice = opt.contextDevice or 0 Reactor.actionRunScene( lul_settings.SceneNum, opt, lul_device ) return 4,0

action.name: StopScene
action.run: -- Stop scene running in Reactor master device context. -- contextDevice is normally the device that originally called for the scene run -- in the Options table. If SceneNum is nil or 0, all scenes for the context device -- will be stopped. Reactor.actionStopScene( lul_settings.contextDevice or lul_device, lul_settings.SceneNum, lul_device )

action.name: StopScene
action.run: -- Stop scene running in ReactorSensor context. -- contextDevice is normally the device that originally called for the scene run -- in the Options table. If SceneNum is nil or 0, all scenes for the context device -- will be stopped. Reactor.actionStopScene( lul_settings.contextDevice or lul_device, lul_settings.SceneNum, lul_device )

action.name: SetVariable
action.run: -- Set a variable value (overwrite/create). if string.match( lul_settings.VariableName or "", "^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$" ) then luup.variable_set( "urn:toggledbits-com:serviceId:ReactorValues", lul_settings.VariableName, lul_settings.NewValue or "", lul_device ) luup.log("Reactor: variable '" .. tostring(lul_settings.VariableName) .. "' set to '" .. tostring(lul_settings.NewValue or "") .. "' by action") else luup.log("Reactor: action attempt to set variable '" .. tostring(lul_settings.VariableName or "") .. "' failed, invalid name", 2) end

action.name: SetGroupEnabled
action.job: -- Set group enabled state. return Reactor.actionSetGroupEnabled( lul_settings.GroupId, lul_settings.newEnabledValue, lul_device )

action.name: GetPluginVersion
action.run: -- Ugly hack. Luup seems to only be able to return values from related state variables (see S_), so use a temp -- one to store the result we want to pass back. Blech. C'mon guys. Amateur hour. Add an extra return argument -- for a table of return values or something, please? local vs, vn = Reactor.getPluginVersion() luup.variable_set("urn:toggledbits-com:serviceId:Reactor", "TempStorage", vs, lul_device) return true

action.name: SetDebug
action.run: local newDebugValue = tonumber(lul_settings.debug or "0") or 0 Reactor.actionSetDebug( debug ~= 0, lul_device ) return true
